bibl.title: Radiogram from M.S. Lombard to Hugh S. Cumming, September 14, 1922

div1.p: Lombard reports to Cumming on a possible yellow fever case involving the death of a Spanish sailor at Mobile, Alabama.

div1.head: Radiogram from M.S. Lombard to Hugh S. Cumming, September 14, 1922
div1.opener:
COPY OF RADIOGRAM
Where written:
Mobile Quarantine, Fort Morgan, Ala., September 14, 1922.
Filed 9:00 P.M.
Cumming,
Public Health Service,
Washington, D. C.
div1.p:
American Schooner William E. Burnham APMIG, ELPIK,
death aboard EWFAL clinical history from Captain and post-
mortem findings Seamen Miguel Vicens forty seven years
Spaniard indicating positive case except DECIM stop
Has Bureau information FAZAL existing Paramaribo or Mungo
Dutch Guiana vessels EJCUG stop BIFEX, BAUZS, ATFOP malaria
Vessel fumigated deceased interned quarantine reservation
Captains request
div1.closer:
(signed) LOMBARD TRUE COPY
L.A.R. 10/18/22
TRANSLATION
American Schooner William E. Burnham arrived to-day, Mobile Quarantine
Fort Morgan Alabama death aboard suspect of yellow fever clinical
history from Captain and postmortem findings Seamen Miguel Vicens
forty seven years Spaniard indicating positive case except incubation
period for, stop Has Bureau information Yellow fever existing
Paramaribo or Mungo Dutch Guiana vessel's Port of departure, stop
Am detaining crew under observation Will make blood examination
malaria Vessel fumigated deceased intermned quarantine reservation
Captains request.
(Signed) LOMBARD.
